engine_status: V2 CYCLE 1 COMPLETE -- First construct-first landscape mapping cycle. 25 signals scanned, 14 clusters identified, 20 business models constructed across 13 verified opportunities. 4 Tier 1, 4 Tier 2, 5 Tier 3. Landscape breadth achieved: professional services, healthcare, insurance, legal, trades, LATAM, compliance, education, AI-native categories all mapped.

tier_1.structural_shift: SMB Accounting/Finance -- Baumol Cure + Jevons Expansion

business_models.name: Fractional AI CFO for Growth SMBs

tier_1.key_signals: 75% CPAs retiring. 70% SMBs unserved. AI accounting market 44% CAGR. Nash equilibrium pre-defection. 95% believe AI central in 5 years but 64% have no training.

tier_1.structural_shift: Healthcare Administration AI -- Largest Baumol Cure in US Economy

business_models.name: AI Healthcare Admin (Revenue Cycle + Prior Auth)
AI Clinical Capacity Multiplier for Nursing

tier_1.key_signals: Healthcare $4.3T market, $1.3T admin. 500K+ nursing shortfall by 2030. Healthcare CPI 4.5% vs 2.5% headline for 20+ years. 47 states with AI healthcare bills.
next_steps: Start with admin (claims, prior auth, coding)

tier_1.structural_shift: Insurance Claims/Operations AI -- Demographic Gap + Dead Business Revival

business_models.name: AI Claims Processing for TPAs and Mid-Market Insurers
AI Claims for LATAM Insurance Market

tier_1.key_signals: 400K insurance workers lost by 2026. 91% adopting AI. Avallon 10x'd at YC. Allianz launched agentic claims. Multimodal AI solves prior accuracy gap. Dead business revival (Lemonade thesis with better AI).
barriers: Claims accuracy for complex cases (start simple)

tier_1.structural_shift: AI-First Legal Services -- YC-Endorsed, Obelisk Model

business_models.name: AI-First Law Firm for SMB Corporate Legal
AI Legal Platform for Solo/Small Firms

tier_1.key_signals: YC RFS: 'start AI law firm.' Legal tech doubling. Obelisk model replacing pyramid. Vendor consolidation 2026. First M&A expected. Law firms mobility score 3/10 (extremely stuck).
barriers: Harvey AI competition (sells to firms, not SMBs)

tier_2.structural_shift: PE Distress Cascade -- Minsky Moment Materializing
tier_2.key_signals: Chapter 11 at 10-year high. PE-backed 30% of filings. Refinancing wall 2025-2027. AI margin compression. Double squeeze.
next_steps: Map distressed firms in CA/West Coast

tier_2.key_signals: 47 states + EU AI Act. RegTech $18.6B growing 17-36% CAGR. FINRA flagging governance gaps. Model law expected 2026.

business_models.name: Bilingual AI Business Services for US-LATAM

tier_2.key_signals: LATAM AI market 26% CAGR. 45% of US companies increasing LATAM hiring. Mexico leads nearshoring. Services exports up 27%.

tier_2.structural_shift: Skilled Trades AI Operations -- Baumol Premium

business_models.name: AI Business Operations Platform for Trades

tier_2.key_signals: 400K+ unfilled trade jobs, 2M by 2033. 41% retiring by 2031. Back-office 20-30% of time. Data center construction amplifying demand.

tier_3.note: Enormous economic force but thin moat in horizontal agent space. Better as vertical-focused strategy.

tier_3.structural_shift: Low-Wage Baumol Sectors (Home Care, Childcare, Social Work)
tier_3.note: Underexplored territory. Sparse AI competition. But low willingness-to-pay and low tech adoption. Volume play.
Massive Jevons expansion but free competitors (Khan Academy). Best angle: LATAM-first with Spanish advantage.
Complement to primary strategy, not standalone. Acquire talent/models from failing AI startups.
Coasean shrinkage is real but low-moat market. Better as feature than business.

structural_shifts_active.note: Foundational force enabling all other opportunities

structural_shifts_active.shift: Jevons Demand Expansion in Professional Services

highest_fit_opportunities.reason: Argentina founder, native Spanish, bilingual AI, LATAM market knowledge
ML builds AI engine, operator handles CPA relationships, Spanish for LATAM expansion
Bilingual, LATAM education market, ML builds adaptive engine
ML builds claims processing, LATAM expansion with Spanish, per-claim model capital-efficient
Core ML competency, capital-efficient agent building

barrier_index_summary.note: v2 cycle 1 -- first barrier catalog. 64% of barriers have moat potential.

v1_vs_v2_comparison.v1_final_state: 11 cycles, 1 PURSUE (Customer Support at 72), 1 INVESTIGATE_FURTHER (Vet at 62), 9 kills, 16 parks, 83% kill/park rate
v1_vs_v2_comparison.v2_cycle_1: 1 cycle, 4 Tier 1, 4 Tier 2, 5 Tier 3 = 13 opportunities mapped, 20 business models constructed, 0 kills
v1_vs_v2_comparison.key_difference: v1 filtered down to 1 PURSUE in 11 cycles. v2 maps 13 opportunities in 1 cycle. v2 treats barriers as moats. v2 includes Jevons expansion in TAM. v2 separates founder fit from opportunity quality. v1's top PURSUE (Customer Support) would score Tier 2 in v2 (~$20B economic force, score ~74).
v1_vs_v2_comparison.note: v1 Customer Support thesis remains valid within v2 landscape. v2 additionally surfaces larger opportunities that v1 filtered out.

cycle_history.note: First v2 landscape mapping cycle. Construct-first approach surfaces 13 distinct opportunities.
